rev.comment: /* Broader historical forces */ "started" seems unclear to me; did everyone stop drinking orange juice? I prefer the weaker "was called", but strengthen it if you like
/* Broader historical forces */ ce; also, oops on the last edit summary, I meant "spokeswoman".
/* Broader historical forces */ [[AP Stylebook]] and [[NYTM]] both say "spokesman", and NYTM feels pretty strongly about it.
/* Broader historical forces */ adding "in the U.S." wil help the reader to shift focus from San Francisco; also, we aren't really claiming a global perspective here
/* Race for state assembly */ please check this for accuracy
/* Race for state assembly */ Okay, this is me at my fussiest: "anytime" gets 100M ghits and I still prefer the traditional "any time"
/* "Heroic things" */ feel free to revert; readers who don't know what "ca-ca" is won't be able to look it up under that spelling, so we should give them a little help
